ca.uwaterloo.epad

Class Application

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Panel
          • java.applet.Applet
            • processing.core.PApplet
              • ca.uwaterloo.epad.Application
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, processing.core.PConstants

    public class Application
extends processing.core.PApplet
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This is the main class of ePad application that contains the drawing loop and manages the GUI components such as Canvas and Drawers. It also handles user interactions with the buttons in the top drawer: Save, Load, Clear, Reset, Colouring Pages and Print.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dmitry Pyryeskin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public void draw()

      • setDrawer

        public static void setDrawer(Drawer newDrawer,
             int drawerId)
        Set the provided drawer to a certain position.
        Parameters:
        newDrawer - new drawer to add to the GUI
        drawerId - position of the new drawer, can be on of the following: TOP_DRAWER, LEFT_DRAWER or RIGHT_DRAWER

      • getDrawer

        public static Drawer getDrawer(int drawerId)
        Get the drawer in a certain position.
        Parameters:
        drawerId - position of the drawer, can be on of the following: TOP_DRAWER, LEFT_DRAWER or RIGHT_DRAWER
        Returns:
        the drawer registered in the provided position or null if no drawer was added to that position

      • isItemAboveDrawer

        public static boolean isItemAboveDrawer(MoveableItem item)
        Determine if the item is above on of the drawers.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to check
        Returns:
        true if the item is above on of the drawers and false otherwise
        See Also:
        Drawer.isItemAbove(Zone)

      • setActionPerformed

        public static void setActionPerformed()
        This method should be called each time user touched the screen. It tracks saves the time of the last action, which helps to determine how long the application has been inactive.

      • getInactiveTime

        Returns:
